definition: lit. to eat off one's own strength (idiom)/fig. to stand on one's own feet/to earn one's own living

sentences.english: He s eighteen now and I believe he can paddle his own canoe.
sentences.chinese: 他已經十八歲了，所以我相信他完全可以自食其力了。

sentences.english: He's eighteen now and I believe he can paddle his own canoe.
sentences.chinese: 他已經十八歲了，所以我相信他完全可以自食其力了。

sentences.english: I'm a ordinary citizen earned by myself all this year.
sentences.chinese: 這一年來我是一個自食其力的小市民。

sentences.english: My son can maintain himself now.
sentences.chinese: 我兒子現在能自食其力了。

definition: to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
to live one's life/to make a living
to provide for/to keep (animals, a family etc)/to raise animals/to feed and clothe/support/the necessities of life/to give birth

to support a family/to raise a family

poor but with great ambitions (idiom)/poor but principled
